title: C−H Bond Activation by Air-Stable [(Diimine)M^(II)(μ_2-OH)]_2^(2+)Dimers (M = Pd, Pt)
abstract: Air- and water-tolerant C−H activation is observed in reactions of [(diimine)Pt(μ_2-OH)]_2^(2+) dimers with allylic and benzylic C−H groups. The reactions proceed in good yields under mild conditions. Mechanistic studies indicate that the active species is the monomeric [(diimine)Pt(OH_2)]^(2+) dication. The related palladium species, [(diimine)Pd(μ_2-OH)_2]^(2+), exhibit similar stoichiometric activations and also effect catalytic oxidation of cyclohexene to benzene with molecular oxygen as the terminal oxidant.

An earlier report on a Pd cluster catalyst, Pd5(PPh3)2, works with O2 alone:  Berenblum, A. S.; Knizhnik, A. G.; Mund, S. L.; Moiseev, I. I. Izv. Akad. Naukk SSSR Ser. Khim. 1980, 2700−2704. Also, Pd{OOC(CF3)}2 aerobically catalyzes the dehydrogenation of cyclohexanone to phenol and cyclohexenone:  Muzart, J.; Pete, J. P. J. Mol.
